instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Keyboard replacement
threads.message:
Hello, does anyone know a way around the function key mapping issue on replacement keyboards?

This <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has a replacement keyboard but without access to the AST 2 server, I can't see a way around getting the function keys to work again.

Just to be clear, the keyboard isn't faulty, its just the function keys that need mapping because its a replacement.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Keyboard replacement
threads.message:
Did you try using USB, or bluetooth keyboard?

If you've got replacement keyboard from another machine, take the trackpad too; it should match its keyboard.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Keyboard replacement
threads.message:
Bluetooth Apple keyboard from an iMac works fine. Haven't tried a USB one.

I thought about replacing the trackpad also but this keyboard was "a new part" from a supplier rather than a specific machine.

I've installed Karabiner and that has got them working but its not the best solution long term in my opinion

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Keyboard replacement
threads.message: AST should set the new keyboard correctly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Keyboard replacement
threads.message: Yeah, no access to AST though unless you're Apple Technician
